intro: Phyllanthus laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and typically grows as a shrub or small tree. The plant features small, simple leaves that are usually smooth and glossy in texture. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Phyllanthus laevigatus is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
